column1: A writing workshop enrolls novelists and poets in a ratio of [a] to [b] . There are [c] people at the workshop . How many novelists are there ? How many poets are there ?

You are selling tickets for a high school play . Student tickets cost [a] dollars and general admission tickets cost [b] dollars . You sell [c] tickets and collect [d] dollars . How many student tickets and general admission tickets did you sell ?

A store is selling compact discs for [a] dollars and [b] dollars . You buy [c] discs and spend a total of [d] dollars . How many compact discs did you buy that cost [a] dollars ? How many did you buy that cost [b] dollars ?

Bob invested [a] dollars in [b] funds , which pay [c] % and [d] % simple interest respectively . The combined interest he earned for both funds was [e] dollars for one year . How many dollars was invested at [c] % ? How much was invested at [d] % ?

Your teacher is giving you a test worth [a] points and containing [b] questions . There are [c] point and [d] point questions on the test . How many two point questions are there ? How many [d] point questions ?
You have [a] dollars and save [b] dollars per week . Your friend has [c] dollars and saves [d] dollars per week . After how many weeks will each of you have saved the same amount of money ?

A theater has [a] seats . On opening night , they sold out , selling adult tickets for [b] dollars each and child tickets for [c] dollars each . If they made a total of [d] dollars , how many child tickets were sold ?
A 20-foot board is cut into [a] pieces . Twice the length of the shorter piece is [b] feet more than the length of the longer piece . Find the length of the shorter piece.

You are traveling to your mothers house that is [a] miles away . If you are currently twice as far from your house as you are from your mothers house how far have you traveled ? Round to the nearest tenth mile.

Colombian coffee beans cost [a] dollars per pound, while Peruvian coffee beans cost [b] dollars per pound . We want to mix the beans together so as to produce a 40-pound bag , costing [c] dollars per pound . How many pounds of Columbian beans and how many pounds of Peruvian beans should be used ?

A total of [a] dollars is invested in [b] funds paying [c] % and [d] % annual interest . The combined annual interest is [e] dollars . How much of the [a] dollars is invested at [c] % ? How much at [d] % ?

For his long distance phone service Milan pays a [a] dollars monthly fee plus [b] cents per minute . Last month , Milan 's long distance bill was [c] dollars . For how many minutes was Milan billed for ?

The maximum load that a horizontal beam can carry is directly proportional to its width . If a beam [a] inches wide can support a load of [b] pounds , find the load that a beam of the same type can support if its width is [c] inches ?

A chemist needs to make [a] ounces of a [b] % alcohol solution by mixing together a [c] % alcohol solution with a [d] % alcohol solution . How many ounces of the [c] % solution should he use ? How many ounces of the [d] % solution ?
The value of a sport utility vehicle this year is [a] dollars , which is [b] of what its value was last year . Find the value of the vehicle last year .

Arianne is mixing a solution for Chemistry class . She has a [a] % copper solution and a [b] % copper solution . How many milliliters of the [a] % solution and [b] % solution should she mix to make [c] milliliters of a [d] % solution ?
The sum of [a] numbers is [b] . The first number is [c] less than twice the second number . Find the smaller number . Find the larger number.

Adult tickets for a play cost [a] dollars and the child tickets cost [b] dollars . If there were [c] people at a performance and the theater collected [d] dollars from tickets sales , how many children attended the play ? How many adults attended the play ?
The Kings won two less than three times as many games as they lost . They played [a] games . How many wins and losses did the team have ?
Find the amount of [a] percent acid solution and the amount of a [b] percent acid solution that Pat should combine to prepare [c] cubic-centimeters of [d] percent solution.

The Johnson Farm has [a] acres of land allotted for cultivating corn and wheat . The cost of cultivating corn and wheat is [b] dollars for corn and [c] dollars for wheat . Mr.Johnson has [d] dollars available for cultivating these crops . If he used all the land and entire budget , how many acres of corn and how many acres of wheat should he plant ?

Trenton sells electronic supplies . Each week he earns [a] dollars plus commission equal to [b] % of his sales . This week his goal is to earn no less than [c] dollars . Write and solve an inequality to find the amount of sales he must make to reach his goal.
A 68-foot pipe is cut into [a] pieces , one of which is [b] feet less than the other . What is the length of the shorter piece in feet ?
Anne and Nancy use a metal alloy that is [a] % copper to make jewelry . How many ounces of a [b] % alloy must be mixed with a [c] % alloy to form [d] ounces of the desired alloy ?

Nine books are to be bought by a student . Some cost [a] dollars each and the remainder cost [b] dollars each . The total amount spent was [c] dollars . How many 6-dollar books were sold ? How many 6.50-dollar books were sold ?

The Booster Club voted on where they would go for their annual trip . A majority of the club voted to go to a baseball game . They bought [a] tickets . Some of the tickets cost [b] dollars per ticket and some cost [c] dollars per ticket . All of the tickets cost [d] dollars . How many 7-dollar tickets did they buy ? How many 9-dollar tickets did they buy ?

Kay spends [a] minutes per week exercising . Her ratio of time spent on aerobics to time spent on weight training is [b] to [c] . How many minutes per week does she spend on aerobics ? How many minutes per week does she spend on weight training ?
Find [a] numbers whose sum is [b] and whose difference is [c] . What is the smaller number ? What is the larger number ?

You are running a concession stand . You are selling hot dogs and soda . Each hot dog costs [a] dollars and each soda costs [b] dollars . You made a total of [c] dollars . You sold a total of [d] hot dogs and sodas combined . You must report the number of hot dogs and sodas sold . How many hot dogs and sodas were sold ?
Find a number so that [a] less than [b] the number is [c] the number.

On Monday , Harold picked up three doughnuts and four large coffees for the office staff . He paid [a] dollars . On Tuesday Melinda picked up five doughnuts and six large coffees for the office staff . She paid [b] dollars . What is the cost of one doughnut ? What is the cost of one large coffee ?

A semi truck travels on a paved road for [a] hours at an average speed of [b] miles per hour faster than it travels on a dirt road . The time spent on the dirt is [c] hours . If the entire trip is [d] miles , how fast is the truck traveling on the dirt road ?

Hockey teams receive [a] points for a win and [b] point for a tie . The wild cats once won a championship with [c] points . They won [d] more games than they tied . How many wins and how many ties did the Wildcats have ?
The sum of [a] numbers is [b] . One number is [c] times the other . Find the smaller number . Find the larger number.
Tickets for a concert were priced at [a] dollars for students and [b] dollars for non-students . There were [c] tickets sold for a total of [d] dollars . How many student ticket were sold ?

Mary began walking home from school , heading south at a rate of [a] miles per hour . Sharon left school at the same time heading north at [b] miles per hour . How long will it take for them to be [c] miles apart ?

The weight of an object on the moon varies directly to its weight on earth . A person who weights [a] pounds on earth weighs [b] pounds on the moon . How many pounds would a 136-pound person weigh on the moon ?
A bank teller has [a] 5-dollar and 20-dollar bills in her cash drawer . The value of the bills is [b] dollars . How many [c] dollars bills are there ?

A total of [a] dollars was invested in two bond mutual funds , a junk bond fund and a government bond fund . The junk fund is risky and yields [b] % interest . The safer government bond fund yields only [c] % . The year 's total income from the two investments was [d] dollars . How much was invested in each fund ?

A student is pricing [a] different picture packages . John 's Photo World charges [b] dollars per sheet and a one time sitting fee of [c] dollars . Sam 's Picture Emporium charges [d] dollars per sheet and a one time sitting fee of [e] dollars . For how many sheets of pictures do the [a] companies charge the same amount ?

Suppose you invest [a] dollars in equipment to put pictures on T-shirts . You buy each T-shirt for [b] dollars . After you have placed the pictures on a shirt , you sell it for [c] dollars . How many T-shirts must you sell to break even ?

Norman and Suzanne Scarpulla own [a] shares of Mcdonald 's stocks and [b] shares of the Ohio Art Company stock . On a particular day in [c] , their stock portfolio consisting of these two stocks was worth [d] dollars . The Mcdonalds stock was [e] dollars more per share than the Ohio Art Company stock . What was the price of McDonalds stock on that day ? What was the cost of the Ohio Art Company stock on that day ?
The difference between two numbers is [a] . If you double both numbers , the sum is [b] . Find the two numbers .
The difference between two numbers is [a] and their sum is [b] . Find the numbers.
A car rented for [a] dollars per day plus [b] dollars per mile . Julia paid [c] dollars for a 1-day rental . How far did she drive , in miles ?

You sell tickets for admission to your school play and collect a total of [a] dollars . Admission prices are [b] dollars for adults and [c] dollars for children . You sold [d] tickets . How many adult tickets did you sell ? How many children 's tickets did you sell ?
A worker gets [a] cents an hour for ordinary time and [b] cents an hour for overtime . If she gets [c] dollars for a [d] hour week , how many hours are overtime ?

A student works [a] part-time jobs . He earns [b] dollars an hour working at the college library and [c] dollars and hour for construction work . To save time for study , be limits his work to [d] hours a week . If he enjoys the work at the library more , how many hours can he work at the library and still earn at [e] dollars a week ?
There are some 2-dollar coins and some 5-dollar coins . There are [a] coins , which give a total amount of [b] dollars . How many 2-dollar coins are there ? How many 5-dollar coins are there ?

At a hotel one night , [a] rooms were booked . Some were single rooms and some were double rooms . The single rooms cost [b] dollars each and the double rooms cost [c] dollars . The hotel made [d] dollars that night . How many single rooms and double rooms were booked ?
[a] of a certain number is [b] more than [c] of a number . Find the number.
One gallon container is full of a [a] % alcohol solution . How much must be drained off and replaced by a [b] % alcohol solution to produce one gallon of [c] % alcohol solution ?

An investor will invest a total of [a] dollars in [b] accounts , one paying [c] % annual simple interest and the other [d] % . If he wants to earn [e] dollars annual interest , how much should he invest at [c] % ? How much at [d] % ?
Stan invested [a] dollars , part at [b] % and part at [c] % . If the total interest at the end of the year is [d] dollars , how much did he invest at [b] % ? How much at [c] % ?

Red cards are worth [a] credits , while blue cards are worth [b] credits . You need any combination of [c] cards to play a game . With [d] credits to buy cards , how many blue cards will you have when you play ? how many red cards will you have when you play ?

Ron and Kathy are ticket-sellers , Ron handling student tickets that sell for [a] dollars each and Kathy selling adult tickets for [b] dollars each . If their total income for [c] tickets was [d] dollars , how many did Ron sell ?

Juan and Peter both leave a shopping center at the same time going in opposite directions . Juan is on his bike and travels [a] miles per hour faster than Peter who is on his skateboard . After [b] hours they are [c] miles apart . How fast does Peter travel ?

An ice skating rink charges [a] dollars for admission and [b] dollars to rent skates . Jill can purchase a new pair of skates for [c] dollars . How many times would she need to go the rink to justify buying the skates rather than renting a pair ?
Pencils cost [a] dollars per carton and erasers cost [b] dollars per carton . If an order comes in for a total of [c] cartons for [d] dollars , what was the specific number of cartons of pencils ?
Find two numbers whose sum is [a] and whose difference is [b]

Walt made an extra [a] dollars last year from a part-time job . He invested part of the money at [b] % and the rest at [c] % . He made a total of [d] dollars in interest . How much was invested at [c] % ?
[a] of a number is [b] more than [c] of the number . Find the number.

A small publishing company is planning to publish a new book . The production costs will include one-time fixed costs and variable costs . The one-time fixed costs will amount to [a] dollars . The variable costs will be [b] dollars per book . The publisher will sell the finished product to bookstores at a price of [c] dollars per book . How many books must the publisher print and sell so that the production costs will equal the money obtained from sales ?
A car rents for [a] dollars per day plus [b] cents per mile . You are on a daily budget of [c] dollars . What mileage can you go and stay within your budget ?

An employment agency specializing in temporary construction help pays heavy equipment operators [a] dollars per day and general laborers [b] dollars per day . If [c] people were hired and the payroll was [d] dollars , how many heavy equipment operators were employed ? How many laborers were employed ?
The sum of two numbers is [a] . The difference of twice of one of them and the other one is [b] . Find both numbers.
A 5-pound bag of apples costs [a] dollars . At the same rate , what would be the cost of [b] pounds of apples in dollars ?

Flying with the wind , a bird was able to make [a] kilometers per hour . If the wind was [b] times as strong and the bird flies against it , it could make only [c] kilometers per hour . Find the velocity of the wind in kilometers per hour . Find the velocity of the bird .

Michael rented a truck for one day . There was a rental fee of [a] dollars , and there also was a charge of [b] cents for each mile . Michael paid [c] dollars when he returned the truck . For how many miles did he drive the truck ?

They charged [a] dollars for adults and [b] dollars for children . [c] adults and children attended , and [d] dollars was made from ticket sales . How many children and adults went to the film premiere ?

A local bus tour sold [a] tickets . Senior citizen tickets cost [b] dollars and regular tickets cost [c] dollars . The total sales were [d] dollars . How many senior citizen tickets were sold ? How many regular tickets were sold ?
Tony planted a [a] foot tree . The tree grows at a rate of [b] feet every year . How many years will it take to be [c] feet ?
Safety Rent A Truck costs [a] dollars plus [b] dollars per mile . City Rentals rents the truck for [c] dollars plus [d] dollars per mile . For what mileage are the costs the same ?

A plane travels due East at [a] miles per hour and another plane travels due west at [b] miles per hour . If they leave at the same time , and from the same place , in how many hours will they be [c] miles apart ?
The difference between [a] times a number and [b] is [c] . Find the number.
A painting is [a] inches tall and [b] inches wide . A print of the painting is [c] inches tall , how wide is the print in inches ?

Colored copies cost [a] cents per copy and white copies cost [b] cents per copy . Sandy made [c] copies , some of which were colored and the rest white . Her total bill was [d] dollars . How many colored copies and white copies did she make ?
In college there are [a] times as many students as professors . If together the students and professors number [b] , how many students are there in college ?

At its Grand Opening , the Guthrie Market distributed two different types of souvenirs . One type cost [a] cents each , and the other type cost [b] cents each . One thousand souvenirs were distributed in all . If the cost of these souvenirs was [c] dollars . How many of [a] cents and [b] cents souveniers were distributed ?

[a] tickets were sold for the Class of [b] ice cream picnic . Each student ticket costs [c] dollars each , and each non-student ticket costs [d] dollars each . A total of [e] dollars was collected . How many student tickets were sold ?
A washer and a dryer cost [a] dollars combined . The price of the washer is [b] times the price of the dryer . What is the cost of the dryer ?

Tickets for a ballet performance cost [a] dollars for adults and [b] dollars for students . If total receipts from the sale of [c] tickets were [d] dollars , how many adult tickets were sold ? How many student tickets were sold ?
Apples cost [a] dollars per pound and grapes cost [b] dollars per pound . Jenny bought [c] pounds of fruit and paid [d] dollars . How many pounds of apples did she buy ? How many pounds of grapes ?
Three times a number is the same as the difference of twice the number and seven . Find the number.
[a] of a number is [b] . What is the number ?
The sum of two numbers is [a] . The larger number is [b] less than twice the smaller number . Find the numbers.
The sum of [a] and a number is [b] .
[a] times a number is added to [b] times a number to get [c] . The second number is [d] less than the first . What is the smaller number ? What is the larger number ?
How many liters of a [a] % acid solution must be mixed with a [b] % acid solution to get [c] liters of a [d] % solution ?

A manufacturer produces two models of the same toy , Model A and Model B . Model A takes [a] hours to produce and costs [b] dollars each . Model B takes [c] hours to produce and costs [d] dollars each . If the manufacturer allots a total of [e] hours and [f] dollars for production each week , how many of each model will be produced ?

An amusement park sells [a] kinds of tickets . Tickets for children cost [b] dollars . Adult tickets cost [c] dollars . On a certain day , [d] people entered the park . On that same day the admission fees collected totaled [e] dollars . How many children were admitted on that day ? How many adults were admitted ?
Post card stamps are [a] dollars each . Letter stamps cost [b] dollars each . If you have [c] stamps worth [d] dollars , how many post card stamps do you have ? How many letter stamps ?

River Joes 's Seafood Diner charges [a] dollars for a catfish dinner and [b] dollars for an order of popcorn shrimp . After filling [c] orders , River Joe had collected [d] dollars . How many orders of popcorn shrimp and catfish dinners did they sell ?

For a matinee , a movie theater charges [a] dollars for children and [b] dollars for adults . At today 's matinee , there are [c] more children than adults and the total receipts are [d] dollars . How many children are at today 's matinee ?
The difference between two numbers is [a] . Their sum is [b] . Find the numbers . What is the larger number ? What is the smaller number ?

Kerry asked a bank teller to cash a [a] dollars check using 20-dollar bills and 50-dollar bills . If the teller gave her a total of [b] bills , how many 20-dollar bills did she get ? How many 50-dollar bills ?

A theater sold [a] tickets to a play . Floor seats cost [b] dollars each and balcony seats [c] dollars each . Total receipts were [d] dollars . How many floor seats were sold ? How many balcony seats were sold ?

A movie theater charges [a] dollars for an adult and [b] dollars for a child 's ticket . One night , [c] tickets were sold for a total of [d] dollars . How many adult tickets were sold ? How many child 's tickets were sold ?

Eldora and Finn went to an office supply store together . Eldora bought [a] boxes of paper clips and [b] packages of index cards for a total cost of [c] dollars . Finn bought [d] boxes of paper clips and [e] packages of index cards for a total cost of [f] dollars . Find the cost of one box of paper clips and the cost of one package of index cards.
The sum of [a] numbers is [b] . The larger number is [a] more than [c] times the smaller number . Find the smaller number . Find the larger number.

A high school sold gift wrap . The gift wrap in solid colors sold for [a] dollars per roll and the print gift wrap sold for [b] dollars per roll . The total number of rolls sold was [c] rolls , and the total amount of money collected was [d] dollars . How many solid rolls were sold ? How many print rolls were sold ?

An embossing shop etches metal with acid solutions . The owner is discussing a certain job with the job supervisor , and they decide to use [a] ounces of a [b] % solution . Upon checking the acid solution supplies , the supervisor has found some [c] % acid solution and some [d] % acid solution , but there is no [b] % acid solution . The owner explains to the supervisor how the two existing solutions can be mixed to obtain a [b] % acid solution . How much of each solution is needed ?

Jane has a dress shop . She has space for [a] dresses . She sells only red and blue dresses . After reading several fashion magazines she decides to stock her shelves with [b] more blue dresses than red dresses . How many blue dresses and red dresses should she stock ?

A special tea blend is made from two varieties of herbal tea , one that costs [a] dollars per kilogram and another that costs [b] dollars per kilogram . How many kilograms of each type are needed to make [c] kilograms of a blend worth [d] dollars per kilogram ?

The Lakers scored a total of [a] points in a basketball game against the Bulls . The Lakers made a total of [b] baskets , consisting of [c] point baskets and [d] point baskets . How many [c] point baskets did the Lakers make ? How many [d] point baskets did the Lakers make ?

In [a] week , a music store sold [b] violins for a total of [c] dollars . [d] different types were sold . One cost [e] dollars and the other cost [f] dollars . How many 200-dollar violins were sold ? How many 300-dollar violins were sold ?
Sunshine Car Rentals rents a basic car at a daily rate of [a] dollars plus [b] per mile . City Rentals rents a basic car at [c] dollars plus [d] per mile . For what mileage is the cost the same ?
The sum of [a] and twice a number is [b] . Find the number.

A company 's profit for the first half of the year is [a] dollars greater than the profit for the second half . If the total annual profit is [b] dollars , find the profit for the first half-year and the second half-year .
It takes a boat [a] hours to travel [b] miles down a river and [c] hours to return upstream to its starting point . What is the rate of the current in the river ?

Pat invested a total of [a] dollars . Part of the money yields [b] percent interest per year and the rest yields [c] percent interest per year . If the total yearly interest from this investment is [d] dollars , how much did Pat invest at [b] percent and how much at [c] percent ?
[a] similar tables and [b] similar chairs cost [c] dollars . If the table cost [d] dollars more than a chair , what is the cost , in dollars , of the table ? What is the cost of the chair ?
The state market has [a] more apples than oranges . There are [b] apples and oranges all together . How many apples are in the market ?
Find the number whose double is [a] greater than its half ?
A carpenter gave an estimate of [a] dollars to build a cover over a patio . His hourly rate is [b] dollars and he expects to need [c] dollars in materials . How many hours will the job take ?

Adult tickets for a play cost [a] dollars and child tickets cost [b] dollars . If there were [c] people at a performance and the theater collected [d] dollars from ticket sales , how many children attended the play ?
kevin bought [a] muffins and a bottle of juice that cost [b] dollars . He paid a total of [c] dollars . How much did each muffin cost ?

[a] blend of coffee sells for [b] dollars per pound and another blend sells for [c] dollars per pound . You want to make a [d] pound blend that sells for [e] dollars per pound . How many pounds of the [c] dollars per pound coffee do you need ? How many pounds of the [b] dollars per pound coffee do you need ?
The tallest player on the basketball team is [a] inches tall . This is [b] inches taller than the shortest player . How tall is the shortest player , in inches ?
[a] of a number decreased by [b] is equal to [c] . Find the number.
The sum of the numbers of boys and girls in a class is [a] . If twice the number of girls exceeds the number of boys by [b] , find the number of girls in the class . Find the number of boys .

The probability that San Francisco plays in the next super bowl is nine times the probability that they do not play in the next super bowl . The probability that San Francisco plays in the next super bowl plus the probability that they do not play is [a] . What is the probability that San Francisco plays in the next super bowl ?
If [a] apples and [b] oranges equals [c] dollars and [b] apples and [d] orange equals [e] dollars , how much does each apple and each orange cost ?
A washer-dryer combination costs [a] dollars . If the washer costs [b] dollars more than the dryer , what does the washer cost ? How much does the dryer cost ?
There are [a] animals in a barnyard . Some are chickens and some are cows . There are [b] legs in all . How many chickens and cows are in the barnyard ?
Riza was [a] when her first son was born . Today the sum of their ages is [b] . How old is Riza and her son now ?

Each unit of grain A contains [a] grams of fat and [b] calories , and unit B has [c] grams of fat and [d] calories . If the final product is to provide [e] grams of fat and [f] calories , how much of grain A and how much of grain B should be used .
Freeport McMoran projects that in [a] the world grain supply will be [b] metric tons and the supply will be only [c] of the world grain demand . What will the world grain demand be in [a] ?
One canned juice drink is [a] % orange juice ; another is [b] % orange juice . How many liters of each should be mixed together in order to get [c] liters that is [d] % orange juice ?

A motorist drove [a] hours at one speed and then for [b] hours at another speed . He covered a distance of [c] kilometers . If he had travelled [d] hours at the first speed and [e] hour at the second speed , he would have covered [f] kilometers . Find two speeds ?

Juliet has a choice between receiving an [a] dollars monthly salary from Furniture by Design or a base salary of [b] dollars and a [c] % commission on the amount of furniture she sells during the month . For what amount of sales will the [d] choices be equal ?
You have [a] total items that consist of hats and boots . The total cost is [b] dollars . Boots cost [c] dollars and hats cost [d] dollars . How many boots are there ? How many hats ?
A [a] ounce can of cranberry juice sells for [b] cents . Give the unit cost in cents per ounce.
Pencils cost [a] cents a piece . Pens cost [b] cents a piece . Susan spent [c] dollars for a total of [d] pens and pencils . How many pencils did she buy ?

Safety Rent-a-Car rents an intermediate-size car at a daily rate of [a] dollars plus [b] per mile . City Rentals rent an intermediate-size car for [c] dollars plus [d] per mile . For what milage is the cost the same ?
Angus invested [a] dollars , part at [b] % and part at [c] % . If the total interest at the end of the year is [d] dollars , how much did he invest at [b] % ? At [c] % ?
Together , Jane and Jill have [a] dolls . Jill has [b] more dolls than Jane does . How many dolls does Jane have ? How many does Jill have ?

Two airplanes left the same airport traveling in opposite directions . If one airplane averages [a] miles per hour and the other [b] miles per hour , how many hours will it take for the distance between them be [c] miles ?

In a basketball game , Will scored [a] points , consisting only of 3-point shots and 2-point shots . He made a total of [b] shots . How many 3-point shots did he make ? How many 2-point shots did he make ?
One number is [a] more than twice a second number . Their sum is [b] . Find the smaller number . Find the larger number.

Lakota bought [a] new compact disks and [b] used compact disks for [c] dollars . At the same prices , Mackenzie bought [d] new compact disks and [e] used compact disks for [f] dollars . Find the cost of buying a single used compact disk .
A garden table and a bench cost [a] dollars combined . The price of the garden table is [b] times the price of the bench . What is the cost of the bench , in dollars ?
Rowan can row [a] kilometers downstream in [b] hours . Returning upstream it takes [c] hours to complete the trip . Find his rate in still water in kilometers per hour and the rate of the current.
Manuel opened a savings account with an initial deposit of [a] dollars . If he wants to save [b] dollars during the next [c] weeks , how much must he save each week , in dollars ?

The first agency charges [a] dollars per day and [b] dollars per mile . The second agency charges [c] dollars per day and [d] dollars per mile . How many miles would you have to drive before the first agency is less expensive than the second ?

Tickets for a concert were priced at [a] dollars for students and [b] dollars for non-students . There were [c] tickets sold for a total of [d] dollars . How many student tickets were sold ? How many non-student tickets ?
A weight of [a] pounds stretches a spring [b] inches . How far will a weight of [c] pounds stretch the spring ?

To buy both a new car and a new house , Tina sought two loans totaling [a] dollars . The simple interest rate on the first loan was [b] % , while the simple interest rate on the second loan was [c] % . At the end of the first year , Tina paid a combined interest payment of [d] dollars . What were the amounts of the two loans ?
A math test is worth [a] points and has [b] problems . Each problem is worth either [c] points or [d] points . How many [d] point problems are there ?

Two investments earn an annual income of [a] dollars . One investment earns an annual simple interest rate of [b] % , and the other investment earns an annual simple interest rate of [c] % . The amount invested is [d] dollars . How much money is invested in the first investment and second investment respectively ?
